frontend.name: MadVods
frontend.description:
A web to show the VODS of Rubius omg holy shit

It's fully made in React and stores the IDs of the videos in a JSON file (I love them) so they can be played in an embeded video or if they are a Google Drive file, send the user to that link.

It's more 'frontend' oriented, almost half the code it's CSS XD.
I was looking for a urban style website and I think it really fits.

frontend.name: Kimuweb
frontend.description:
The website you are in right now!!1!

My personal portfolio, I am trying to learn by doing crazy stuff here, it's not intended to look professional, I am not a professional, I dont like being professional, I am just dumb :P

It's built in react as always, I don't like big frameworks, and obviously almost all the code is CSS, that's the funny stuff right there.

backend.name: NestJS
backend.description:
NestJS is my favourite backend network, I am trying to understand the dark world of the backend with it and god it makes it easier.

My latest app with it is an authentication app with JWT, Passport and Prisma with Docker.
It lets you register, login, see what you saved and add 'bookmarks' which is just some text and an image.

Nothing fancy but it is my first attempt at it -w-

backend.name: NextJS
backend.description:
My first contact with backend was with NextJS.

I wanted to make an e-commerce shop template and used it to retrieve the items from PostgreSQL database.

I liked doing it but I hate big frontend frameworks so I stayed with React.

backend.name: Express
backend.description:
With Express I made an API to save images and audios to the server.

You uploaded something via the frontend and it made a request to the API which checked if the file should be saved.

It was my first API, even tho it was 'dirty' it was fun coding it.
